update.description:
In c++11 the following statements are equivalent:

~~~
std::shared_ptr<Typename> x(new std::shared_ptr<Typename>(arg1, arg2));
~~~

~~~
auto x = std::make_shared<T>(arg1, arg2);
~~~

`make_shared` is more concise, but it is also [safer in certain cases](http://herbsutter.com/gotw/_102/). There is no `make_unique` in c++11 however; though it will be in c++14. In the meantime, [it is recommended](http://herbsutter.com/gotw/_102/) to include a version of `make_unique` in your own code ([dartsim has already done it](https://github.com/dartsim/dart/pull/639)). I've copied one such implementation into `gazebo/util/make_unique.hh` namespaced as `gazebo::make_unique`. The function is not declared as visible and the header file is not installed; it's just for internal use.

I've used it in a couple places, which should be a sufficient test.
update.title: Create gazebo::make_unique while we wait for c++14, use it in a few places

pull_request.title: Create gazebo::make_unique while we wait for c++14, use it in a few places
